page.title: 13LYPIATT PARK
page.content: Lypiatt Park is a very big house and parts of it are very old. The oldest remaining part is a 14th century granary. It has stables, a dove-cote and its own small church which is now used as a store. It has turretted decorations all along the top like a castle. The park, once full of deer is now about ten acres It has magnificent views from the front garden all along the Toadsmoor Valley. From it one can see almost all of the land covered in this part of the survey. For centuries it was the home of wealthy and influencial families most notably the Stephens. Now most of the land has been sold off. For the last thirty years it has been owned by an internationally famous sculptor. The interior furnishings have been changed to complement the contemporary sculptures which are housed there.
